SENT.plain: Four families from the same region of Cambodia immigrated to the Pacific Northwest of the United States
All four families have been discovered to have spinocerebellar ataxia type 3 (SCA 3; Machado-Joseph disease) with a similar clinical phenotype
CAG repeat expansions in the ATXN3 gene range from 72 to 77
Mean age of onset has varied from 19 to 44 years and mean age at death of 4 individuals has been 60 years
The prevalence of the various subtypes of SCA varies worldwide from country to country
Neurologists should be alert to the possibility of SCA 3 in Cambodian patients with unexplained cerebellar ataxia
